description:
(My experience on the bottom, main points up here)

Overall: Good service I would reccomend it above Monday and Asana for personal use and maybe businesses 

Pros: Clean, free, easy to use, good organization, and very customizable 

Cons: It limits how many custom columns you can have


i've got really bad adhd so having a reminder service where i can track what i'm doing and write down my ideas make my life so much easier. I've used monday and asana, but both kinda sucked. Monday wasn't free and i found that out the hard way when i lost all of my reminders because i didn't pay. Asana doesn't have a desktop app and doesn't actually look that good either. I haven't really had any issues with Clickup so far. Most of it is intuitive and easy to get started with. It does get more complex if you want it to be; this includes columns and integrations (clickup's term for outside software like discord, github, or google calendar) which makes everything more organized and only takes a day or two to learn.
UI has lots of issues, almost looks like a program from the 90s somehow. Cannot use at the moment
summary: Kinda works but UI is half broken

description:
Just works
Does exactly what it's supposed to do
summary: Does exactly what it's supposed to do

description: Simple, but useful little solution. Works as it should.
The sidebar dissapears after a while and you have to restart to get it back

I have been able to use it for 2 days. After that, the sidebar in which you can see all the spaces, folders... is not showing anymore.

It seems like an error that the push service not available or something like that when using developing tools.

I'll have to keep using the browser method...
summary: Spaces/folders/lists panel is not showing anymore

description:
I can refer to "jabaldev"s review. the same happened here.
The app had been working well for long time, but recent bug makes it unusable.
summary: Used to be working well, but recently does not work

description: App doesn't work. Won't even let you sign in. Just use the web app instead.
i can't see that side, so i don't use it further. In clickup official site they provide a app image. it doesn't have that bug
summary: There is a bug to show that side menu part

description: Get the app image from clickup website instead
Doesnt' work side panel bug
The sidebar on the left is not visible at all. I am unable to move between spaces. check notification or do anything that are available on the sidebar
It opens, and then shows half of a random page- like half of a list. No menu to navigate between objects.
Sidebar is buggy. Please think about a fix
Wrapping ClickUp was a good idea, but the buggy sidebar make this app unusable. Hope it will be fixed.
Every time I login - it leads to memory lock on the latest ubuntu and freeze entire OS
summary: the service is great. App - is bad

description: Thankfully, the sidebar issues that persisted for a while have been fixed. However, there's an error in how the lists appear.
summary: Need to fix appearance of lists

description: Very similar to other people's reviews recently. The sidebar is somehow hidden and not usable, therefore the app is useless this way too
Just download it from the web because this version is outdated always
summary: Just download it from the Web
